definition: Jawaharlal Nehru (1889-1964), Indian politician, first prime minister 1947-1964
Buddhist nun/(often used in phonetic spellings)
surname He
awe-inspiring/abbr. for 赫茲|赫兹[he4 zi1], hertz (Hz)
(bound form) crass/stupid/rude/(used to represent the sounds of "ru", "lu" etc in loanwords)
surname Lu/Lu, ancient state of China 魯國|鲁国[Lu3 guo2]/Lu, short name for Shandong 山東|山东[Shan1 dong1]

sentences.english: Nehru was succeeded by Lal Bahadur Shastri, who also died in office.
sentences.chinese: 尼赫鲁的继任者拉尔巴阿杜夏斯，谁也死在办公室。
尼赫鲁以他一贯的大度之风作了回答。

sentences.english: Nehru DID NOT make ANY mistakes. That's what Arun Jaitley found out.
sentences.chinese: 简特莱发现尼赫鲁什么错误也没犯。

sentences.english: What about the famous JNU ( Jihadi Naxal University ) ?
sentences.chinese: 著名的尼赫鲁大学排第几？

definition: Le Duan (1907-1986), Vietnamese communist politician
Nikita Khrushchev (1894-1971), secretary-general of Soviet Communist Party 1953-1964
Indian Congress party
Modi (name)/Narendra Modi (1950-), Indian BJP (Bharatiya Janata Party or Indian People's Party) politician, Gujarat Chief Minister from 2001, PM from 2014
Joseph Stalin (1879-1953), Soviet dictator

Mountbatten (name, Anglicization of German Battenberg)/Lord Louis Mountbatten, 1st Earl Mountbatten of Burma (1900-1979), British commander in Southeast Asia during WWII, presided over the partition of India in 1947, murdered by the IRA.
(King) Sihanouk (of Cambodia)
(Mahatma) Gandhi
Anwar Al Sadat
Pol Pot (1925-1998), Cambodian communist leader
Indian Congress party
Gorbachev/Mikhail Sergeyevich Gorbachev (1931-), last president of the Soviet Union 1991-1995
Leonid Brezhnev (1906-1982), Soviet statesman, General Secretary of the Communist Party of the USSR 1966-1982
Non-Aligned Movement (NAM)
Dwight D. Eisenhower (1890-1969), US army general and politician, Supreme Allied Commander in Europe during World War II, US President 1953-1961
Aung San Suu Kyi (1945-), Myanmar opposition leader and 1991 Nobel Peace laureate/also written 昂山素姬
